content.description: Start on the crimp rail at about head height.  Campus the first move into a sharp jug and climb up over the bulge.  Definitely possible to get a lower start using some knee bar trickery.
content.location: Along the trail into grave of the underpants on the left hand side.

content.description: Crazy highball/ solo that doesn't really seem like it should be a boulder problem
content.protection: Lotsa pads definitely wouldn't want to fall near the top
content.location: Right before Grave of the Underpants, same approach

climbs.name: Grave of the Underpants Sit V7

content.description: The climb starts below an obvious jug flake (V6 start) on an undercling, and good feet. Climb to the jug flake, pull powerful moves to the top holds, and transition to the roof arete behind you. Finish the climb by standing on the last jug holds at the end of the roof arete.
content.protection: Bare minimum two pads, preference toward many pads
content.location: You can get here easily by walking past Orbit (waterway west boulders), you'll see a majestic rock corridor, floored with cobble stone.. walk through it, then through some thin trees, scramble a squeeze between a boulder and a chopped tree. Then start heading left. You'll see the top part of this boulder on your right.

content.description: Start on jug flake and climb out the roof. Get established on the arete feature and make moves to the jugs out right to top out.
content.location: Start on the largest chalked up jug under the roof.
Across the waterway from the caves.

content.description: Start on the sidewall and move up the same arete feature as Grave of the Underpants to the same topout. You can also solo to the top but it's bold/ sketch and would be a horrible fall but you would get to check out the nice medical center in Sonora (a great time)
content.location: Left of the start of Grave of the Underpants under the arete feature.
